column1: 48B6E29A-EF8F-408E-99D0-D1E031F2070E#appfire#A7ADC443-C4B8-4274-8681-C3F9202F50C5#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 12:27:57.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 12:27:57.0#appfire#1

column1: B39A5C8C-C0D9-4371-BF2A-54F1154B302D#appfire#A7ADC443-C4B8-4274-8681-C3F9202F50C5#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 12:27:57.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 12:27:57.0#appfire#1
